title: [BUG] SkiaSharp.Views.Forms 2.88.3.0 causes version conflicts with its dependencies
body:
**Description**

The SkiaSharp 2.88.3.0 nuget package contains a DLL with a file version of 2.88.3.0 but an assembly version of 2.88.0.0. Visual Studio creates version conflicts and recommended binding redirects warning for both SkiaSharp and the platform specific SkiaSharp.Views.* assemblies.

**Expected Behavior**

No warning output.

**Actual Behavior**

The warnings below are output.

Adding the recommended binding redirects does remove the warning, but the recommendation is to redirect to 2.88.0.0.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  2.88.3.0
- Last known good version:  I believe the last "good" version is 2.88.0.0. The versions in between all have an assembly version of 2.88.0.0 as well and so I believe they have the same problem. I think the only one of them that I tried was 2.88.2.0.
- IDE:  Visual Studio
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Android: monoandroid1.0
  - iOS:  xamarinios1.0
  - The other targets appear to have the same assembly version and so I believe they would have the same problem.
  
<details>
  <summary>Detailed IDE/OS information (click to expand)</summary>
  
```
1>  Consider app.config remapping of assembly "SkiaSharp, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=0738eb9f132ed756" from Version "2.80.0.0" [] to Version "2.88.0.0" [%USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp\2.88.3\lib\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.dll] to solve conflict and get rid of warning.
1>  Consider app.config remapping of assembly "SkiaSharp.Views.Android, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=0738eb9f132ed756" from Version "2.80.0.0" [] to Version "2.88.0.0" [%USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp.views\2.88.3\lib\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.Views.Android.dll] to solve conflict and get rid of warning.
1>C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\2022\Enterprise\MSBuild\Current\Bin\amd64\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targets(2352,5): warning MSB3247: Found conflicts between different versions of the same dependent assembly. In Visual Studio, double-click this warning (or select it and press Enter) to fix the conflicts; otherwise, add the following binding redirects to the "runtime" node in the application configuration file: <assemblyBinding xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1"><dependentAssembly><assemblyIdentity name="SkiaSharp" culture="neutral" publicKeyToken="0738eb9f132ed756" /><bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-2.88.0.0" newVersion="2.88.0.0" /></dependentAssembly></assemblyBinding><assemblyBinding xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1"><dependentAssembly><assemblyIdentity name="SkiaSharp.Views.Android" culture="neutral" publicKeyToken="0738eb9f132ed756" /><bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-2.88.0.0" newVersion="2.88.0.0" /></dependentAssembly></assemblyBinding>
```

The package being referenced directly in the project is SkiaSharp.Views.Forms. A package named [Microcharts.Forms](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microcharts.Forms/) is also referenced. It has a dependency on SkiaSharp (>=2.80.2) and SkiaSharp.Views.Forms (>=2.80.2).

If the binding redirects are changed to redirect to 2.88.3.0, then the warning behavior changes. Two different version conflict warnings are generated (as opposed to one with two binding redirects recommended). 

In this case the warnings list the references that that depend on the two conflicting versions for both assemblies. In both cases the Microcharts assembly is (correctly?) listed as referencing 2.88.3.0 (because of the binding redirect).

And both of the SkiaSharp assemblies (so in the above case it would be SkiaSharp and SkiaSharp.Views.Android) that have a version of 2.88.3.0 are each listed as depending on version 2.88.0.0 of itself and then the other SkiaSharp.* assemblies are listed as depending on version 2.88.3.0.

Below is the warning for SkiaSharp. The warning for SkiaSharp.Views.Android and SkiaSharp.Views.iOS are similar.

```
Found conflicts between different versions of "SkiaSharp" that could not be resolved.
There was a conflict between "SkiaSharp, Version=2.88.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=0738eb9f132ed756" and "SkiaSharp, Version=2.88.3.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=0738eb9f132ed756".
    "SkiaSharp, Version=2.88.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=0738eb9f132ed756" was chosen because it was primary and "SkiaSharp, Version=2.88.3.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=0738eb9f132ed756" was not.
    References which depend on "SkiaSharp, Version=2.88.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=0738eb9f132ed756" [%USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp\2.88.3\lib\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.dll].
        %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp\2.88.3\lib\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.dll
          Project file item includes which caused reference "%USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp\2.88.3\lib\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.dll".
            %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp\2.88.3\lib\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.dll
    References which depend on "SkiaSharp, Version=2.88.3.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=0738eb9f132ed756" [].
        %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts\0.9.5.9\lib\MonoAndroid10\Microcharts.Droid.dll
          Project file item includes which caused reference "%USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts\0.9.5.9\lib\MonoAndroid10\Microcharts.Droid.dll".
            %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts\0.9.5.9\lib\MonoAndroid10\Microcharts.Droid.dll
        %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts.forms\0.9.5.9\lib\netstandard2.0\Microcharts.dll
          Project file item includes which caused reference "%USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts.forms\0.9.5.9\lib\netstandard2.0\Microcharts.dll".
            %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts.forms\0.9.5.9\lib\netstandard2.0\Microcharts.dll
            %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts\0.9.5.9\lib\MonoAndroid10\Microcharts.Droid.dll
            %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts.forms\0.9.5.9\lib\netstandard2.0\Microcharts.Forms.dll
        %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts.forms\0.9.5.9\lib\netstandard2.0\Microcharts.Forms.dll
          Project file item includes which caused reference "%USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts.forms\0.9.5.9\lib\netstandard2.0\Microcharts.Forms.dll".
            %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\microcharts.forms\0.9.5.9\lib\netstandard2.0\Microcharts.Forms.dll
        %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp.views\2.88.3\lib\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.Views.Android.dll
          Project file item includes which caused reference "%USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp.views\2.88.3\lib\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.Views.Android.dll".
            %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp.views\2.88.3\lib\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.Views.Android.dll
        %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp.views.forms\2.88.3\ref\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.dll
          Project file item includes which caused reference "%USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp.views.forms\2.88.3\ref\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.dll".
            %USERPROFILE%\.nuget\packages\skiasharp.views.forms\2.88.3\ref\monoandroid1.0\SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.dll
```
</details>

The original binding redirect that was recommended does seem to fix the issue, assuming that 2.88.0.0 DLL is the correct assembly for 2.88.3.0. If that is the case, then there probably isn't any problem other than unnecessary warnings/binding redirects.

I suspect this may be because the API hasn't changed since 2.88.0.0 and only some file or metadata changed in the package or the DLL itself that required new file versions and so only those were incremented?

Either way, I thought I would report this because something doesn't seem quite right.
